>From: "John Arrowwood" <jarrowwx@...>
> >If you still want to evolve an averaging network
>
>The averaging is just a side-effect.  More on that below...

Oops, forgot to expand on that.

Averaging is just a side-effect of having arbitrary-scale enlargement.  In 
order to pull off what it is I'm trying to do, I need to have one part that 
takes in the inputs and uses them as parameters to define a 'curve' that 
approximates the shape of those inputs.  The curve would be continuous, 
whereas the inputs are not.

Then, to query that model, that curve, I want to be able to specify an 
'area' of that curve.  And I want the output to be the average hight of the 
curve within that area.

This is roughly equivalent to the current way that enlargement is done.  
They use 'splines' to describe the curvature of the inputs, and then output 
a smaller portion of the curve in order to extract the output pixels.  
Mathematically, it can be done.  It just may take a whole LOT of topology to 
pull it off.  I'm okay with that!  As long as I'm not throwing more topology 
at it than is necessary.
